title: Myrtle Avenue Summer Nights
description: An evening of free live music, activities, and fun for the whole family featuring music from Rome Neal's Banana Puddin' Jazz, Jem Bleu at Corkscrew & DJ Del, along with family-friendly activities along Myrtle Avenue and the Myrtle Plaza.
address: Fort Greene and Clinton Hill, Brooklyn

title: Warm Up 2024
description: MOMA’s annual outdoor party series brings beats and bodies to PS1’s Long Island City courtyard for six nights, featuring a lineup that includes DJs and artists from various cities.

title: Summer Sway at The Shed
description: Celebrating the roots of hip hop with free performances highlighting queer, trans, and BIPOC community-based art.

title: Brooklyn Poets Summer Workshop Showcase
description: An evening of readings featuring teachers and students from Brooklyn Poets’ summer workshops.

title: Kweendom
description: An LGBTQ+ comedy and storytelling show featuring performances by various artists.

title: The Deliverance
description: Screening of Lee Daniels' film followed by a Q&A with Daniels moderated by Bradley Cooper.

title: Seventh Annual MX. Nobody Pageant
description: Brooklyn's most transgressive all-gender, all-style drag competition returns for its seventh year.

title: Dreamland Roller Disco
description: Lola Star’s themed skate parties return to Prospect Park’s LeFrak Center for another season.

title: Best Night Ever: Comedy Music Party
description: Comedy, music, and party combine at this event featuring various performers.

title: Rooftop Films Summer Series: Look Into My Eyes
description: Screening of a documentary followed by a Q&A with the director and featured psychics.

title: Kate Sisk
description: Comedian Kate Sisk performs a new hour of stand-up at Littlefield.

title: Bitches Brew Comedy Show
description: A women-produced and hosted comedy show featuring various stand-up comedians.

title: Str8 West Coastin'
description: West coast hip-hop vibes take over Friends and Lovers at this annual dance party spun by DJs Eleven, Still Life, and Dizam.
